item.title: Boosting My Career Journey with Techie Youth!

item.content:encoded:
The Birth of My Tech Journey

I first learned about computer programming in 7th grade, through Khan Academyâ€™s Intro to JS and HTML / CSS modules.

I marveled at how I was able to talk to computers as though they were people, writing commands that would produce my intended final product.

But once I reached the section on Object-Oriented Programming, I got stuck, and ended up taking a break from learning web development for 6 years.

How I Discovered Techie Youth

I was randomly selected to participate in Techie Youthâ€™s Learn to E-Earn through a random placement by New Yorkâ€™s Summer Youth Employment Program.

Techie Youth, a non-profit charity, provides career training and education resources to empower teens in foster-care and other at-risk youth.

The Learn to E-Earn program in particular is an opportunity for all youth to learn key skills in technology to advance their career journey.
Joining Techie Youthâ€™s E-Earn program provided me the opportunity to finally revisit my earlier passion for computing.

Skills I’ve Learned Through Techie Youth

Through the different course units, I became exposed to various new remote tech careers, ranging from web development, data analysis, recruitment, to writing blogs like this one!

Introductory Units

All students start the program by participating in two prerequisite units to build a foundation for a successful career.

I got to update my online profile, edit my resume, and develop a cover letter template. I also learned strategies to ace job interviews and network strategically with other people such as potential mentors.

To supplement this, I learned how to improve my own life quality and overall work productivity by managing my time, stress, and health.

Web Development

Once students finish the prerequisite units, theyâ€™re able to move on to any elective units of their choice! 

I decided to pick up right where I had left off 6 years ago by using the web development unit to brush up on my HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

In just a few days, I was able to review skills that initially took me a year to build, thanks to the clear and direct resources linked in Techie Youthâ€™s units.

I then moved on to preview various other computing languages such as PHP and Python, frameworks like WordPress and Node.JS, and software like GitHub.

All of these sections helped me gain a well-rounded understanding of how different components of web development work together to produce a smooth user experience.

To conclude this unit, I used the skills I gained to create a personal website (which youâ€™re on right now)! I used the Intrace theme on WordPress, customized it using HTML and CSS to make the website responsive on mobile devices, and then hosted my website for free on GitHub Pages.

While Iâ€™ve come across lots of bumps along the way, being able to produce a portfolio website has been a thrilling experience!

Writing Skills

Ever since my creative writing class in 10th grade, I knew that I loved writing about myself. So now that I created a functional personal website, why not supplement it by learning how to write blogs? 

Through Techie Youthâ€™s writing unit, I became exposed to various types of remote writing jobs, many of which I had never heard of previously.

Who knew that you could make an entire profession out of ghostwriting, transcribing, or producing technical writing? Not me!

I learned how to adapt my writing style to accommodate different professions. For example, the way a customer service agent communicates might not be the same as a prose author, which definitely wonâ€™t be the same as a journal or grant writer.

I also learned strategies to make blog posts easier to digest, such as incorporating headings to make content easily skimmable.

item.title: Welcome!
item.dc:creator: Tahsin Uddin
item.description: Hi there, and welcome! I initially developed this blog as an assignment in my internship at Techie Youth. I’ll use this platform to share insight I’ve gained throughout my life, as well as to discuss topics I am passionate about. I hope you enjoy the content I share! Check out some of my other blog posts below:
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to My Blog!

Hi there, and welcome!

I initially developed this blog as an assignment in my internship at Techie Youth.

I’ll use this platform to share insight I’ve gained throughout my life, as well as to discuss topics I am passionate about.

I hope you enjoy the content I share!

Check out some of my other blog posts below:
